description.displayText: Kayla is great and my boys ages 7 & 10 love her. She helps my 7 year old with his homework and will even take the boys outside and play with them. I like that she's experienced with children having disabilities because my 10 year is autistic. She's very dependable and punctual.
description.originalText: Kayla is great and my boys ages 7 & 10 love her. She helps my 7 year old with his homework and will even take the boys outside and play with them. I like that she's experienced with children having disabilities because my 10 year is autistic. She's very dependable and punctual.

description.displayText: Kayla was a great help at the last minute for watching our 15 month old son. She was reliable & our son seemed to cling to her right away. Would definitely hire her again in the future.
description.originalText: Kayla was a great help at the last minute for watching our 15 month old son. She was reliable & our son seemed to cling to her right away. Would definitely hire her again in the future.

description.displayText: Kayla was fantastic and my three loved her. She was tasked to watch my 10 month old, 3 year old and 8 year old because their school had a teacher work day. She watched them from 730 to 330 and she still had a smile on her face when i got home, so did my kids. Would hire again!
description.originalText: Kayla was fantastic and my three loved her. She was tasked to watch my 10 month old, 3 year old and 8 year old because their school had a teacher work day. She watched them from 730 to 330 and she still had a smile on her face when i got home, so did my kids. Would hire again!

description.displayText: Kayla is a very bright young lady who is wise beyond her years. She graduated high school with a 4.0 grade point average and remains on her college dean's list. She speaks Spanish and has studied the language abroad in Costa Rica. Kayla is also a black belt in karate and has worked with youth ages 6-17 at the YWCA teaching them self defense skills. Kayla has younger siblings ages 5 and 3, both with special needs whom she has a love for by teaching,developing and caring for them. Kayla is reliable, responsible and takes initiative in whatever she is tasked with. At the age of 16, Kayla's maturity allowed her to nanny a 10 year old boy where she was responsible for driving him to sport practices and events, assisting with homework and cooking light meals.
